intro: Sideroxylon microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry forests and scrublands. The wood of Sideroxylon microphyllum is highly valued for its durability and resistance to decay.
